items.content: You are being invited to participate in a research titled "Exposing the public opinion on AI systems". The researchers involved in this study are Thanos Masouris, Tianyu Mo, Connor Schilder, Andrei Stefan, and Xin Wan from the TU Delft.

The purpose of this research is to identify the public opinion and perception about Artificial Intelligence (AI) of European residents, and will take you approximately 20 minutes to complete. The data will be used to write a report, summarizing and discussing the results, and will not be published in any scientific article. We will be asking you to answer a few short questions about AI and to interact with a few systems.

**Important notice: there are quality control questions integrated into the survey, which determine whether or not the contributor will be rewarded. This means that wrong answers to those questions will be marked and may lead to no payment. This is mainly done to prevent dishonest answers and bots, so if you DO NOT answer randomly for each question, this will not be an issue. Since these need to be checked manually, the payment will not be provided as soon as you finish the survey, but we vouch to approve answers as soon as possible (within 24 hours at the latest).**

As with any online activity the risk of a breach is always possible. To the best of our ability your answers in this study will remain confidential. We will minimize any risks by completely anonymizing data after collection and only use it for the specified purposes. The data will be stored on Toloka and will be deleted after the study.

Your participation in this study is entirely voluntary and you can withdraw at any time. You are free to decide you no longer want to participate, in which case you answers will not be recorded and you can simply exit the page.

The responsible researchers for this study are Thanos Masouris (<A.Masouris@student.tudelft.nl>), Tianyu Mo (<T.Mo@student.tudelft.nl>), Connor Schilder (<C.K.Schilder@student.tudelft.nl>), Andrei Stefan (<A.A.Stefan@student.tudelft.nl>), and Xin Wan (<X.Wan-2@student.tudelft.nl>).
By checking the box below, you confirm that you have read the information above and agree to voluntarily participate in the study.
### Do you agree to take part in the above study?

items.content: In the following you will be asked to interact with some systems. When the prompt specifies "Please take some time to intreact with the system" (or something similar), please make sure you do so, as some of the questions refer to the interaction. It is not necessary to spend a long time doing so (30 seconds to a minute should be enough to answer all questions). When it is not specified that you should interact with the system, it is not necessary to do so, but you can use the provided link in case you don't know the system or to refresh your memory about it.
### Machine Translation

You have probably used Google translate before, but in case you havenâ€™t used it recently, try using the detect language feature and see how many words (or letters) it takes to detect the language. Also try to mix languages and see if Google can keep up with the translation. Please take some time to use the system's features and then answer the following questions
Google Translate

items.content: ### Spam Filter

Spam filters are generally used for filtering email inboxes. There is an online resource that enables you to visualize this process below. Please take some time to use the system (you can use the example given by the website or come up with one of your own), then check at least one of the examples given below, and then answer the following questions
Spam Filter

validation.hint: Make sure you access the link

items.content: **Example 1**: compare the following two:

a) Dear James, Thank you for the quick reply. I still have some questions about the payment. Could we arrange a meeting sometime? You can fill in your preference for a time by clicking this link: someshadywebsite.scam. Looking forward to your reply! Kind regards, Mark

b) Dear James, Thank you for the fast reply. I still have some questions about the money. Could we talk soon? You can fill in your preference for a time if you click on this form: someshadyform.scam. Please do this as soon as possible. Kind regards, Mark
**Example 2**: compare the following two
a) Hey James, Long time no see. Do you want to meet this weekend? I know a place where we could have lunch. Let me know if you're available. Regards, Mark

b) Hey James, Please read your emails from time to time... you are impossible to reach sometimes. Let's meet soon and have some lunch. I know a place with cheap and tasty food. Give me a call to let me know if you can make it. Cheers, Mark

items.content: ### Search Engines

You have probably used Google (or some other search engine) before. There is a link to more information about the features it offers and to Google itself below. Additionally, Google queries can be refined through operators. Some of the most useful ones are: quotes for searching results that contain a specific term (e.g. â€œpotato saladâ€ recipe), asterisk which acts as a wildcard which can be replaced by any word (e.g. â€œ * saladâ€ recipe), filetype or ext for results with a specific document type (e.g. â€œpotato saladâ€ recipe filetype:pdf), site for specific websites (e.g. â€œpotato saladâ€ recipe site:allrecipes.com), and in for converting units (e.g. 5 kg in pounds)â€™. Please take some time to use the system (you can use the given examples) and then answer the following questions
Google feature

items.content: In this last question you are asked to order some of the systems, based on your perception of their complexity.

The systems to be ordered are the following: 
 (1) Machine translation 
 (2) Computer games 
 (3) Spam filter 
 (4) Search engines 
 (5) Weather forecasts 
 (6) Chatbots

items.label: Please order the systems, by typing in the corresponding numbers, separated by commas (no spaces), from least complex (left) to most complex (right).
items.hint: Valid answers are, for example: 1,2,3,4,5,6 or 1,5,2,3,4,6. Invalid answers are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 (due to the spaces), 1,1,3,4,2,6 (due to repeating 1 and not using 5)

validation.hint: Please, add all of the systems and only once
